aiGenerationMetadata.appInitialisationPrompt: Our company has expanded from working with eight suppliers to managing relationships with over thirty vendors across raw materials, equipment maintenance, and professional services, but we're still tracking everything through scattered spreadsheets and email folders. We frequently miss contract renewal deadlines, leading to unexpected price increases or service interruptions that disrupt our production schedules and strain our vendor relationships. We need a centralized vendor management system that stores comprehensive supplier contact information including primary and backup contacts, payment terms, and preferred communication methods. The system should track contract start and end dates with automated alerts for upcoming renewals, giving us sufficient lead time to negotiate better terms or evaluate alternative suppliers before commitments expire. Our procurement team requires access to complete purchase order history for each vendor, including order dates, amounts, delivery performance, and payment status to identify spending patterns and evaluate vendor reliability. The database should maintain detailed records of product categories, pricing structures, and service level agreements to support better purchasing decisions and budget forecasting. Search functionality by vendor name, product category, or contract status would help our growing team quickly locate supplier information during urgent procurement situations. We need filtering capabilities to review vendors by geographic region, contract value, or renewal timeline to streamline our quarterly vendor performance reviews and annual budget planning. Basic reporting on vendor spending totals and contract distribution would provide management visibility into our supply chain dependencies and help identify opportunities for cost consolidation or diversification across our expanding operations.

options.query: SELECT v.name as vendor_name, COALESCE(SUM(po.total_amount), 0)::DECIMAL(12,2) as total_spending FROM vendors_10649f v LEFT JOIN purchase_orders_10649f po ON v.id = po.vendor_id WHERE v.status = 'active'::TEXT GROUP BY v.id, v.name ORDER BY total_spending DESC LIMIT 6

SELECT a.activity_description, a.created_at, CONCAT(u.first_name, ' ', u.last_name)::TEXT as user_name FROM activity_logs_10649f a LEFT JOIN users_10649f u ON a.user_id = u.id ORDER BY a.created_at DESC LIMIT 10

UPDATE user_preferences_10649f SET dashboard_layout = :dashboard_layout::TEXT, time_zone = :time_zone::TEXT, email_notifications = :email_notifications::BOOLEAN, contract_renewal_alerts = :contract_alerts::BOOLEAN, vendor_performance_alerts = :performance_alerts::BOOLEAN, budget_threshold_alerts = :budget_alerts::BOOLEAN, updated_at = NOW() WHERE user_id = 1

SELECT AVG(vp.delivery_performance_score)::DECIMAL(5,2) as avg_delivery_performance, AVG(vp.quality_score)::DECIMAL(3,1) as avg_quality_score, SUM(vp.cost_savings_achieved)::DECIMAL(12,2) as total_cost_savings FROM vendor_performance_10649f vp WHERE vp.evaluation_period_end >= (CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '12 months')

SELECT COUNT(po.id)::INTEGER as total_orders, COUNT(CASE WHEN po.status IN ('pending'::TEXT, 'in_transit'::TEXT) THEN 1 END)::INTEGER as pending_orders, COUNT(CASE WHEN po.expected_delivery_date < CURRENT_DATE AND po.status != 'delivered'::TEXT THEN 1 END)::INTEGER as overdue_orders, COALESCE(SUM(po.total_amount), 0)::DECIMAL(12,2) as total_value FROM purchase_orders_10649f po WHERE po.order_date >= DATE_TRUNC('month'::TEXT, CURRENT_DATE)

SELECT po.id, po.po_number as poNumber, v.name as vendor, po.order_date::TEXT as orderDate, po.expected_delivery_date::TEXT as deliveryDate, CONCAT('$', po.total_amount::TEXT)::TEXT as amount, INITCAP(po.status::TEXT) as status, 'Items (' || (SELECT COUNT(*)::TEXT FROM purchase_order_items_10649f poi WHERE poi.purchase_order_id = po.id) || ' items)' as items, INITCAP(po.payment_status::TEXT) as paymentStatus FROM purchase_orders_10649f po INNER JOIN vendors_10649f v ON po.vendor_id = v.id WHERE (COALESCE(:status_filter::TEXT, 'all') = 'all' OR po.status = :status_filter::TEXT) ORDER BY po.order_date DESC

SELECT c.id, v.name as vendor, c.contract_type as contractType, CONCAT('$', c.contract_value::TEXT)::TEXT as value, c.start_date::TEXT as startDate, c.end_date::TEXT as endDate, c.renewal_date::TEXT as renewalDate, CASE WHEN c.renewal_date <= (CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '30 days') THEN 'Expiring Soon' ELSE INITCAP(c.status::TEXT) END as status, CASE WHEN c.auto_renewal THEN 'Yes' ELSE 'No' END as autoRenewal, UPPER(c.payment_terms::TEXT) as paymentTerms FROM contracts_10649f c INNER JOIN vendors_10649f v ON c.vendor_id = v.id ORDER BY c.renewal_date ASC

SELECT c.id, v.name as vendor, c.contract_type as contractType, CONCAT('$', c.contract_value::TEXT)::TEXT as value, c.start_date::TEXT as startDate, c.end_date::TEXT as endDate, c.renewal_date::TEXT as renewalDate, CASE WHEN c.renewal_date <= (CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '30 days') THEN 'Expiring Soon' ELSE INITCAP(c.status::TEXT) END as status, CASE WHEN c.auto_renewal THEN 'Yes' ELSE 'No' END as autoRenewal, UPPER(c.payment_terms::TEXT) as paymentTerms FROM contracts_10649f c INNER JOIN vendors_10649f v ON c.vendor_id = v.id WHERE (COALESCE(:status_filter::TEXT, 'all') = 'all' OR (COALESCE(:status_filter::TEXT, 'all') = 'active' AND c.status = 'active'::TEXT) OR (COALESCE(:status_filter::TEXT, 'all') = 'expiring' AND c.renewal_date <= (CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '30 days')) OR (COALESCE(:status_filter::TEXT, 'all') = 'expired' AND c.status = 'expired'::TEXT)) AND (COALESCE(:value_filter::TEXT, 'all') = 'all' OR (COALESCE(:value_filter::TEXT, 'all') = 'under50k' AND c.contract_value < 50000) OR (COALESCE(:value_filter::TEXT, 'all') = '50k200k' AND c.contract_value BETWEEN 50000 AND 200000) OR (COALESCE(:value_filter::TEXT, 'all') = 'over200k' AND c.contract_value > 200000)) ORDER BY c.renewal_date ASC

SELECT v.id, v.name, v.business_category, v.primary_contact_email as contact, v.primary_contact_phone as phone, v.status, CONCAT('$', v.total_contract_value::TEXT)::TEXT as contractValue, v.performance_rating as performance FROM vendors_10649f v ORDER BY v.name ASC

UPDATE system_settings_10649f SET setting_value = CASE setting_key WHEN 'contract_alert_threshold_days' THEN :contract_threshold::TEXT WHEN 'budget_variance_alert_percentage' THEN :budget_variance::TEXT WHEN 'default_payment_terms' THEN :payment_terms::TEXT WHEN 'auto_renewal_default' THEN :auto_renewal::TEXT WHEN 'performance_review_frequency' THEN :review_frequency::TEXT WHEN 'minimum_contract_value' THEN :min_contract_value::TEXT WHEN 'data_retention_period' THEN :retention_period::TEXT WHEN 'backup_frequency' THEN :backup_frequency::TEXT ELSE setting_value END, updated_by = 1, updated_at = NOW() WHERE setting_key IN ('contract_alert_threshold_days', 'budget_variance_alert_percentage', 'default_payment_terms', 'auto_renewal_default', 'performance_review_frequency', 'minimum_contract_value', 'data_retention_period', 'backup_frequency')

SELECT up.dashboard_layout, up.time_zone, up.email_notifications, up.contract_renewal_alerts, up.vendor_performance_alerts, up.budget_threshold_alerts FROM user_preferences_10649f up WHERE up.user_id = 1

SELECT COUNT(CASE WHEN status = 'active'::TEXT THEN 1 END)::INTEGER as active_contracts, COUNT(CASE WHEN renewal_date <= (CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '30 days') AND status = 'active'::TEXT THEN 1 END)::INTEGER as expiring_soon, COUNT(CASE WHEN status = 'under_negotiation'::TEXT THEN 1 END)::INTEGER as under_negotiation, COUNT(CASE WHEN status = 'cancelled'::TEXT THEN 1 END)::INTEGER as cancelled FROM contracts_10649f

SELECT po.id, po.po_number as poNumber, v.name as vendor, po.order_date::TEXT as orderDate, po.expected_delivery_date::TEXT as deliveryDate, CONCAT('$', po.total_amount::TEXT)::TEXT as amount, INITCAP(po.status::TEXT) as status, 'Items (' || (SELECT COUNT(*)::TEXT FROM purchase_order_items_10649f poi WHERE poi.purchase_order_id = po.id) || ' items)' as items, INITCAP(po.payment_status::TEXT) as paymentStatus FROM purchase_orders_10649f po INNER JOIN vendors_10649f v ON po.vendor_id = v.id ORDER BY po.order_date DESC

-- Enable UUID extension for PostgreSQL
CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS "uuid-ossp";
-- Drop existing tables in reverse dependency order if they exist
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS notifications_10649f CASCADE;
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS activity_logs_10649f CASCADE;
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS user_preferences_10649f CASCADE;
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS system_settings_10649f CASCADE;
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS vendor_performance_10649f CASCADE;
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS purchase_order_items_10649f CASCADE;
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS purchase_orders_10649f CASCADE;
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS contracts_10649f CASCADE;
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS vendor_contacts_10649f CASCADE;
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS vendors_10649f CASCADE;
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS users_10649f CASCADE;
-- Create users table for different personas in the vendor management system
CREATE TABLE users_10649f (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL UNIQUE,
    email VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL UNIQUE,
    first_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    last_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    role VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL CHECK (role IN ('procurement_manager', 'procurement_specialist', 'finance_controller', 'operations_manager')),
    department VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    phone VARCHAR(20),
    is_active BOOLEAN DEFAULT true,
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
    updated_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
);
-- Create vendors table - main vendor directory with business information
CREATE TABLE vendors_10649f (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    business_category VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL CHECK (business_category IN ('manufacturing', 'technology', 'logistics')),
    primary_contact_email VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    primary_contact_phone VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
    business_address TEXT,
    status VARCHAR(50) DEFAULT 'active' CHECK (status IN ('active', 'inactive', 'under_review')),
    payment_terms VARCHAR(50) DEFAULT 'net30' CHECK (payment_terms IN ('net15', 'net30', 'net45')),
    performance_rating VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'good' CHECK (performance_rating IN ('excellent', 'good', 'fair', 'poor')),
    total_contract_value DECIMAL(12,2) DEFAULT 0.00,
    created_by INTEGER REFERENCES users_10649f(id),
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
    updated_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
);
-- Create vendor contacts table - additional contact persons for vendors
CREATE TABLE vendor_contacts_10649f (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    vendor_id INTEGER NOT NULL REFERENCES vendors_10649f(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    contact_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    contact_email VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    contact_phone VARCHAR(20),
    contact_role VARCHAR(100),
    is_primary BOOLEAN DEFAULT false,
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
    updated_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
);
-- Create contracts table - contract lifecycle management
CREATE TABLE contracts_10649f (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    vendor_id INTEGER NOT NULL REFERENCES vendors_10649f(id),
    contract_type VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    contract_value DECIMAL(12,2) NOT NULL,
    start_date DATE NOT NULL,
    end_date DATE NOT NULL,
    renewal_date DATE NOT NULL,
    status VARCHAR(50) DEFAULT 'active' CHECK (status IN ('active', 'expiring_soon', 'expired', 'cancelled', 'under_negotiation')),
    auto_renewal BOOLEAN DEFAULT false,
    payment_terms VARCHAR(50) DEFAULT 'net30' CHECK (payment_terms IN ('net15', 'net30', 'net45')),
    sla_uptime_guarantee DECIMAL(5,2),
    sla_response_time_hours INTEGER,
    penalty_clause_percentage DECIMAL(5,2),
    contract_terms TEXT,
    created_by INTEGER REFERENCES users_10649f(id),
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
    updated_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
);
-- Create purchase orders table - purchase order records with delivery tracking
CREATE TABLE purchase_orders_10649f (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    po_number VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL UNIQUE,
    vendor_id INTEGER NOT NULL REFERENCES vendors_10649f(id),
    order_date DATE NOT NULL DEFAULT CURRENT_DATE,
    expected_delivery_date DATE NOT NULL,
    actual_delivery_date DATE,
    total_amount DECIMAL(12,2) NOT NULL,
    status VARCHAR(50) DEFAULT 'pending' CHECK (status IN ('pending', 'approved', 'in_transit', 'delivered', 'cancelled')),
    payment_status VARCHAR(50) DEFAULT 'pending' CHECK (payment_status IN ('pending', 'approved', 'paid', 'cancelled')),
    order_notes TEXT,
    created_by INTEGER REFERENCES users_10649f(id),
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
    updated_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
);
-- Create purchase order items table - line items for each purchase order
CREATE TABLE purchase_order_items_10649f (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    purchase_order_id INTEGER NOT NULL REFERENCES purchase_orders_10649f(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    item_description TEXT NOT NULL,
    quantity INTEGER NOT NULL CHECK (quantity > 0),
    unit_price DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL CHECK (unit_price >= 0),
    total_price DECIMAL(12,2) GENERATED ALWAYS AS (quantity * unit_price) STORED,
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
);
-- Create vendor performance table - performance evaluations and metrics
CREATE TABLE vendor_performance_10649f (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    vendor_id INTEGER NOT NULL REFERENCES vendors_10649f(id),
    evaluation_period_start DATE NOT NULL,
    evaluation_period_end DATE NOT NULL,
    delivery_performance_score DECIMAL(5,2) CHECK (delivery_performance_score >= 0 AND delivery_performance_score <= 100),
    quality_score DECIMAL(3,1) CHECK (quality_score >= 0 AND quality_score <= 5.0),
    cost_savings_achieved DECIMAL(12,2) DEFAULT 0.00,
    late_deliveries_count INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    sla_breach_count INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    overall_rating VARCHAR(20) CHECK (overall_rating IN ('excellent', 'good', 'fair', 'poor')),
    performance_notes TEXT,
    evaluated_by INTEGER REFERENCES users_10649f(id),
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
);
-- Create system settings table - system-wide configuration
CREATE TABLE system_settings_10649f (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    setting_key VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL UNIQUE,
    setting_value TEXT NOT NULL,
    setting_description TEXT,
    setting_type VARCHAR(50) DEFAULT 'string' CHECK (setting_type IN ('string', 'number', 'boolean', 'json')),
    is_system_setting BOOLEAN DEFAULT true,
    updated_by INTEGER REFERENCES users_10649f(id),
    updated_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
);
-- Create user preferences table - individual user preferences
CREATE TABLE user_preferences_10649f (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INTEGER NOT NULL REFERENCES users_10649f(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    dashboard_layout VARCHAR(50) DEFAULT 'compact' CHECK (dashboard_layout IN ('compact', 'detailed', 'executive')),
    time_zone VARCHAR(50) DEFAULT 'eastern',
    email_notifications BOOLEAN DEFAULT true,
    contract_renewal_alerts BOOLEAN DEFAULT true,
    vendor_performance_alerts BOOLEAN DEFAULT false,
    budget_threshold_alerts BOOLEAN DEFAULT true,
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
    updated_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
    UNIQUE(user_id)
);
-- Create activity logs table - comprehensive activity logging
CREATE TABLE activity_logs_10649f (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INTEGER REFERENCES users_10649f(id),
    activity_type VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    entity_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL CHECK (entity_type IN ('vendor', 'contract', 'purchase_order', 'user', 'system')),
    entity_id INTEGER,
    activity_description TEXT NOT NULL,
    metadata JSONB,
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
);
-- Create notifications table - user notifications and alerts
CREATE TABLE notifications_10649f (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INTEGER REFERENCES users_10649f(id),
    notification_type VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL CHECK (notification_type IN ('contract_renewal', 'performance_issue', 'budget_threshold', 'payment_due', 'system_alert')),
    title VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    message TEXT NOT NULL,
    priority VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'medium' CHECK (priority IN ('low', 'medium', 'high', 'urgent')),
    is_read BOOLEAN DEFAULT false,
    related_entity_type VARCHAR(50),
    related_entity_id INTEGER,
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
    read_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE
);
-- Create indexes for better performance
CREATE INDEX idx_vendors_status ON vendors_10649f(status);
CREATE INDEX idx_vendors_category ON vendors_10649f(business_category);
CREATE INDEX idx_contracts_status ON contracts_10649f(status);
CREATE INDEX idx_contracts_renewal_date ON contracts_10649f(renewal_date);
CREATE INDEX idx_purchase_orders_status ON purchase_orders_10649f(status);
CREATE INDEX idx_purchase_orders_order_date ON purchase_orders_10649f(order_date);
CREATE INDEX idx_notifications_user_id ON notifications_10649f(user_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_notifications_is_read ON notifications_10649f(is_read);
-- Insert sample user data
INSERT INTO users_10649f (username, email, first_name, last_name, role, department, phone) VALUES

('Global Supplies LLC', 'manufacturing', 'alex.rodriguez@globalsupplies.com', '555-0145', '9012 Supply Chain Dr, Houston, TX 77001', 'active', 'net30', 'excellent', 89200.00, 2),

SELECT v.id, v.name, v.business_category, v.primary_contact_email as contact, v.primary_contact_phone as phone, v.status, CONCAT('$', v.total_contract_value::TEXT)::TEXT as contractValue, v.performance_rating as performance FROM vendors_10649f v WHERE (COALESCE(:search_term::TEXT, '') = '' OR UPPER(v.name::TEXT) ILIKE UPPER(CONCAT('%', :search_term::TEXT, '%'))) AND (COALESCE(:category_filter::TEXT, 'all') = 'all' OR v.business_category = :category_filter::TEXT) AND (COALESCE(:status_filter::TEXT, 'all') = 'all' OR v.status = :status_filter::TEXT) ORDER BY v.name ASC

SELECT COUNT(v.id)::INTEGER as total_vendors, COUNT(CASE WHEN c.status = 'expiring_soon'::TEXT THEN 1 END)::INTEGER as contracts_expiring, COALESCE(SUM(po.total_amount), 0)::DECIMAL(12,2) as monthly_spending FROM vendors_10649f v LEFT JOIN contracts_10649f c ON v.id = c.vendor_id LEFT JOIN purchase_orders_10649f po ON v.id = po.vendor_id AND po.order_date >= DATE_TRUNC('month'::TEXT, CURRENT_DATE) WHERE v.status = 'active'::TEXT

INSERT INTO vendors_10649f (name, business_category, primary_contact_email, primary_contact_phone, business_address, total_contract_value, payment_terms, created_by) VALUES (:vendor_name::TEXT, :business_category::TEXT, :contact_email::TEXT, :phone_number::TEXT, :business_address::TEXT, :contract_value::DECIMAL(12,2), :payment_terms::TEXT, 2)

INSERT INTO purchase_orders_10649f (po_number, vendor_id, expected_delivery_date, total_amount, order_notes, created_by) VALUES (CONCAT('PO-', TO_CHAR(NOW(), 'YYYY-MM'), '-', LPAD(NEXTVAL('purchase_orders_10649f_id_seq')::TEXT, 4, '0'))::TEXT, (SELECT id FROM vendors_10649f WHERE LOWER(name::TEXT) ILIKE :vendor_selection::TEXT LIMIT 1), :delivery_date::DATE, (:quantity::INTEGER * :unit_price::DECIMAL(10,2)), :order_notes::TEXT, 2)

SELECT c.id, c.contract_type, c.contract_value::DECIMAL(12,2), c.renewal_date, v.name as vendor_name FROM contracts_10649f c INNER JOIN vendors_10649f v ON c.vendor_id = v.id WHERE c.renewal_date <= (CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '7 days') AND c.status IN ('active'::TEXT, 'expiring_soon'::TEXT) ORDER BY c.renewal_date ASC

SELECT COUNT(CASE WHEN c.renewal_date <= (CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '7 days') THEN 1 END)::INTEGER as urgent_renewals, COUNT(CASE WHEN c.renewal_date <= (CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '30 days') THEN 1 END)::INTEGER as upcoming_renewals, COALESCE(SUM(CASE WHEN c.renewal_date <= (CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '7 days') THEN c.contract_value ELSE 0 END), 0)::DECIMAL(12,2) as urgent_value FROM contracts_10649f c INNER JOIN vendors_10649f v ON c.vendor_id = v.id WHERE c.status IN ('active'::TEXT, 'expiring_soon'::TEXT)
SELECT ss.setting_key, ss.setting_value FROM system_settings_10649f ss WHERE ss.is_system_setting = true ORDER BY ss.setting_key ASC

ALTER TABLE vendors_10649f DROP CONSTRAINT IF EXISTS vendors_10649f_business_category_check; ALTER TABLE vendors_10649f ADD CONSTRAINT vendors_10649f_business_category_check CHECK (business_category IN ('manufacturing'::TEXT, 'technology'::TEXT, 'logistics'::TEXT, 'petrochemical industry'::TEXT))
